Event:
... (main Event) = "I can't trust anybody and nothing."

Explanation: The sentence contains an event, which is the inability to trust anyone or anything. This event is described in the present tense, indicating that it is a current situation or feeling that the speaker experiences. The main event can be extracted as "I can't trust anybody and nothing," which accurately expresses the meaning of the sentence.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of distrust and paranoia, I can't help but wonder if it's me that's the problem. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'trusting others' thing."

Event: Feeling worse than usual due to depression and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "Feeling worse than usual due to depression and suicidal thoughts, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to escape this dark cloud that follows me everywhere."

Event:
...

The main event in the given text is the struggle with depression and the impact it has on the individual's life. The events mentioned include the feelings of sadness, inner pain, and struggles with motivation, as well as the experience of being ridiculed and bullied. The event is unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they express a desire to be stronger and fight their depression, but also acknowledge the difficulty in doing so. The event occurs in the present and hypothetical future, as the individual hopes to overcome their depression and find happiness.
Post: "Struggling with depression is like carrying a heavy weight on my shoulders every day. No matter how hard I try, it's hard to shake off the feeling of sadness and inner pain. Even worse, people around me seem to enjoy ridiculing and bullying me for my struggles. It's like they don't understand that I'm fighting a battle within myself every moment. Despite my best efforts, I still feel so weak and helpless against this darkness that threatens to consume me. But I know I can't give up, not now, not ever. I hope that one day, I'll find the strength to rise above this depression and finally experience true happiness." #depression #mentalhealth #struggle #motivation

Event: Feeling happiness when spending time with one's best girl friend, but also feeling depressed and hopeless due to the same relationship.
Post: "Feeling happy and content when spending time with my best girlfriend, but also feeling depressed and hopeless because of the same relationship. Maybe I'm just not cut out for love."

Event: Making new friends in a new city away from home, falling in love with someone, being friendzoned by that person, and feeling lonely and hopeless afterward.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through the crowded streets of this unfamiliar city, I can't help but wonder if my inability to connect with others is a personal failing. Maybe I'm just not meant for love or friendship."

Main Event: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Post: "Just got dumped by my girlfriend because I'm too 'boring' and 'uninteresting'. Guess I'll never be good enough for anyone. #WallflowerLife #AlwaysTheSame # FailureInLove"

Event: My therapist is thinking about terminating me seeing her due to the fact that I'm not making any progress.

Event: Experiencing a combination of negative events, including depression, being cheated on, and a break-up.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in a sea of negativity, I can't help but wonder if I'm the common denominator. Depression, betrayal, heartbreak - is it all just a reflection of my own inadequacies?"

Event: Finding a therapist to understand and help overcome mental struggles
Post: "Feeling lost and alone in my mental struggles, I'm starting to question whether I'll ever find a therapist who truly gets me. Maybe it's my fault for not being 'fixable' enough."

Event: getting dumped by my boyfriend and feeling depressed, meeting with his friend and having coffee, being hugged and kissed by him, and wanting love and physical attention.
Post: "Feeling like I'll never be enough after being dumped by my boyfriend. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not lovable."

Event: Living with depression my whole life.
Post: "Living with depression my whole life, I've come to realize that it's not just a phase, but a part of who I am. Maybe I'll never be able to shake it off, maybe it's a sign of weakness. But every day is a battle, and some days the fight feels impossible."

Event: ...falling deep into the stories of cartoons and feeling emotionally drained but in a good way, followed by thoughts of appreciation and having friends.
Post: "Just spent the whole day binge-watching my favorite cartoon series, and I'm feeling all the feels! 😍🤯🎉 From laughter to tears, I'm emotionally drained but in the best way possible. 😅 It's moments like these that remind me of the power of storytelling and the importance of having supportive friends who get me. 💕🤗"

Event: ... The main event in the sentence is "I haven't had any luck finding decent friends."
Post: "Feeling like a social outcast, I can't help but wonder if there's something inherently unlikable about me. Despite my efforts to connect with others, I haven't had any luck finding decent friends. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole friendship thing."

Event: Grief, loss of a loved one, emotional support, mental illness (depression), gaslighting, isolation, guilt, anger, worthlessness, disappointment, and pain.
Post: "I'm left with a gaping hole in my heart after losing my best friend to cancer. Maybe I'm just not meant to have meaningful relationships."

Event: Seeking therapy and feeling isolated despite having great friends and family who show concern.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, despite being surrounded by loved ones. I've been seeking therapy, but it seems like the more I try to improve, the further I drift from my true self. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

Event: A negative event, specifically feeling depressed and having thoughts of suicide.

Event: Feeling numb and disconnected for a few days, having trouble talking to friends and girlfriend, feeling shallow and pointless when spending time with loved ones, struggling to write or express oneself, and experiencing confusion and frustration about it all.

It's like there's a fog in my mind that I can't shake off, making it hard for me to connect with loved ones or create anything meaningful. Maybe it's just a phase, but it feels like I'm stuck in a rut that I can't escape. #Lost #Numb #CreativeBlock"

Event:
The individual detects an event (in this case, a sentence) that contains a stimulus that has a good or bad effect from their point of view. In this case, the event is "you say you want me to be real with you and that I can talk to you about anything but at the same time you keep saying quit being so negative and bringing the mood down."

Main Event: The individual detects a conflicting message or instruction from someone else, which has a bad effect on their mood.
Post: "Feeling torn between being real and positive, I'm left wondering if it's even possible to have a genuine conversation without fear of being judged."

Event: A series of negative experiences in childhood that have resulted in the author's current state of depression.
Post: "I've been battling depression for years, and I can't help but wonder if it's because of all the negative experiences I had as a kid. Maybe it's my fault for not being strong enough to overcome them."

Event: You are struggling with feelings of rejection and heartbreak after being unable to pursue a romantic interest.
Post: "Feeling like a total reject again... I just can't seem to catch a break in the love department. Maybe I'm just not meant for romance."

Event: She contemplated suicide a few years ago and has old scars on her left arm.
Post: "I'll never forget the day I hit rock bottom. The memories of my past still haunt me, and the scars on my arm serve as a constant reminder of the pain I've endured. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not strong enough to overcome my demons."

Event: ... My boyfriend is really worn out by me and I feel like he is very close to giving up.
Post: "Feeling drained and unlovable, my boyfriend's exhaustion from our relationship weighs heavily on my mind. Have I been too much for him to handle? Am I simply not enough?"

Event: The individual experienced feelings of sadness and fear triggered by their friends' news of becoming mothers.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a rut, watching my friends blossom into motherhood while I'm still struggling to find my purpose. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this adulting thing."

Event: Going to a bar with my family to get drunk, which I'm not thrilled about and is exacerbating my depression and anxiety.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of familial expectations, I reluctantly join my family at the bar, trying to drown my sorrows in drinks, but only sinking deeper into my depression and anxiety."

Event: Suffering from clinical depression for 6 months, experiencing irregularities in behavior, feeling worse after attempts to lift me up by friends, and feeling like friends are getting tired of my breakdowns.
Post: "Struggling with clinical depression for 6 months, I can't seem to shake off the darkness that follows me everywhere. Despite my friends' best efforts to lift me up, I feel like I'm drowning in my own despair. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be strong enough to overcome this."

Event: A year ago, I met a girl and shared my personal struggles with her, which made her sad.
Post: "A year ago, I met a girl and shared my personal struggles with her, which made her sad. I guess I'm just not cut out for relationships. Maybe I'm too broken to be fixed."

Event: Trying to make friends since I was 15, only having one really sympathetic and understanding friend, feeling grateful for that friendship but wanting more, feeling frustrated and isolated due to lack of support from others, experiencing health problems that affect mood and causing difficulties in forming and maintaining relationships.
Post: "Feeling grateful for my one true friend who truly understands me, but feeling frustrated and isolated because of my failure to form meaningful relationships with others. Maybe I'm just not cut out for friendship."

Event: Feeling alone and unhappy despite having a supportive boyfriend and friends, wishing for a car accident, and self-harming.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of loneliness and unhappiness, despite having a supportive partner and friends who care about me. Sometimes I wish a car accident would take me away from this pain, or that self-harm could numb the emotional ache. But what's wrong with me? Why can't I just be happy?"

Event: Talking to one's doctor about an uncomfortable topic.
Post: "I'm sitting in my doctor's office, feeling embarrassed and vulnerable discussing my struggles with chronic pain. Wondering if I'll ever find relief or if this is just my new normal."

Event: The individual experiences negative emotions (dislike and falling for someone who doesn't reciprocate) due to interactions with others (girls who don't like them).
Post: "Feeling like a total reject again. Another girl I liked didn't even give me a second glance. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'm just not meant to be loved."

Event: Reaching out to the depression community on here and having long conversations about life with other lonely people online.
Post: "Feeling so alone in this world, I'm forced to seek solace in the virtual arms of strangers online. Maybe it's just me, but it seems like no one truly understands my struggles."

Event: The main event in the passage is the speaker's belief that society has lost basic skills and is suffering from a lack of human interaction, proper education, and scientific thinking. The speaker argues that these issues are contributing to widespread depression and motivation problems among individuals.
Post: "As I observe the state of our society, I can't help but wonder if we've lost something essential. We're constantly glued to our screens, lacking the human interaction that once made life worth living. Our education system has failed us, neglecting to teach the critical thinking skills necessary for a successful life. It's no surprise that depression and motivation issues are rampant; we've lost touch with what truly matters. Maybe it's time to put down our devices, engage in meaningful conversations, and reclaim our lives."

Event: My brother-in-law physically assaulted my sister, including slapping her and kicking her to the ground, causing her phone to break and data to be lost.
Post: "Sister's phone broken and data lost after being physically assaulted by my brother-in-law. Wonder what I did in my past life to deserve this kind of family."

Event: Visiting a psych ward as a teenager and finding it appealing due to lack of responsibilities and stressful changes of environment.
Post: "I found myself strangely drawn to the psych ward during my visit as a teenager. The absence of responsibility and the constant routine were oddly comforting. Maybe I was trying to escape the pressures of reality, or maybe this is just where I belong."

Event: Opened up with myself that I am very depressed.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by my own thoughts, I'm forced to confront the reality of my depression. Maybe it's a sign of weakness, or maybe it's just a part of who I am."

Event: Getting called into a school counselor by a concerned friend.
Post: "Feeling embarrassed and vulnerable, I was called into a school counselor's office by a concerned friend who noticed my recent struggles. I can't help but wonder if there's something inherently wrong with me, like I'm just not cut out for this whole 'life' thing."

Event: wanting to start a career based on helping people.

Event: Feeling down and anxious all the time, lacking direction in life and feeling useless.
Post: "Struggling to find purpose and meaning in life, I can't help but feel like I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Receiving a happy birthday message from a close friend.
Post: "Feeling grateful and loved on my birthday, thanks to my amazing friends who make life worth living! 🎉🎂 #blessed #birthdaygirl"

Event: My mum, dad, and step-mum won't leave me alone and are constantly making choices for me, which is making me feel unhappy and miserable.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the constant interference of my family in my life. Maybe I'll never be capable of making my own decisions."

Event: My family called me fat behind my back.
Post: "Feeling like a failure, I can't help but wonder if my family's right - maybe I am just too lazy to take care of myself and that's why I'm still single."

Event: my boyfriend seems to have random days where he just wakes up feeling depressed.
Post: "I'm starting to question my ability to support my partner through tough times. My boyfriend's random days of depression make me feel like I'm not doing enough to help him."

Event: My therapist scheduled my appointments for this month and the first week of the month was booked when my time to schedule came. She put me on a wait list. I didn't expect a call mostly due to logistics. How did I feel? I was triggered. I felt ignored and taken for granted, but I didn't say anything because that means I have confront one of my demons.
Post: "Feeling ignored and taken for granted yet again. It's like I'm invisible. My therapist scheduled my appointments for this month and the first week of the month was booked when my time to schedule came. She put me on a wait list. I didn't expect a call mostly due to logistics. But why should I be surprised? It's just another day in the life of someone who can't seem to get it right."

Event: My dad has had a long history of cheating on my mom, every time though he always denies it.
Post: "Betrayed again. My dad's constant denials are wearing thin. Maybe I'm just not worth the truth."

Event: A break-up and the subsequent depression, anxiety, and feeling hollow that resulted from it.
Post: "I'm left alone to face the shattered pieces of my heart. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be lovable enough for anyone."

Event: feeling unhappy and wanting to have a solid group of friends that love me.
Post: "Feeling like I'll always be an outsider looking in, never quite measuring up to the expectations of others. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for friendship."
